728510f-a.folder: Bay Street & Evelyn Place, Staten Island, NY
728510f-a.text:
1370 Bay Street, between Evelyn Place and Hope Avenue. The Robinson map of 1898 shows it to have been the home of
John Larkin.
April 30, 1931
P. L. Sperr

728536f-a.folder: Bay Street & Nautilus Street, Staten Island, NY
728536f-a.text:
Bay Street, east side, between Nautilus Street and New lLane, showing St. John's Protestant Episcopal Church.
View 1: May 26, 1926
View 2: July 11, 1933
P. L. Sperr

728538f-a.folder: Bay Street & Nautilus Street, Staten Island, NY
728538f-a.text:
Bay Street, at the N.E. corner of Nautilus Street, shown is the telegraph building of.the United Swates Quarantine Station, near the shore of the Upper New York Bay.
July 19, 1926
Views 1, 2
P. L. Sperr

728539f-a.folder: Bay Street & Nautilus Street, Staten Island, NY
728539f-a.text:
(1) and (2)
Bay Street, at the N.E. corner of Nautilus Street. Shown are buildings of the United States Quarantine Station, as seen from the Upper New York Bay. The house on the left is the Doctor's Residence, about 100 years old.
P. L. Sperr  July 19, 1926
(3)
The Quarantine Station, seen from Cliff Street.
Viewing north.
April 29, 1931
P. L. Sperr

728539f-b.text:
(1) and (2)
Bay Street, at the N.E. corner of Nautilus Street. Shown are buildings of the United States Quarantine Station, as seen from the Upper New York Bay. The house on the left is the Doctor's Residence, about 100 years old.

728540f-a.folder: Bay Street & Nautilus Street, Staten Island, NY
728540f-a.text:
(1)
Bay Street, at the N.E. corner of Nautilus Street. Shown is the U. S. Quarantine Station as seen from the Upper New York Bay. The old building on the left is the Western Union telegraph office and on the right is the Doctor's Residence,about 100 years old. Visible too, is the steeple of St. Johns P. E.
Church.
August 17, 1934
P. L. Sperr
(2)
The old Western Union telegraph office and newly erected buildings, seen from the interior of the Quarantine.
May 31, 1937
P. L. Sperr

728540f-b.text:

Bay Street, at the N.E. corner of Nautilus Street. Shown is the U. S. Quarantine Station as seen from the Upper New York Bay. 728541f-a.folder: Bay Street & Nautilus Street, Staten Island, NY
728541f-a.text:
(1)
Bay Street, at the N.E. corner of Nautilus Street, showing the driveway into the U.S. Quarantine Station,and ground being broken for a new building. The view is eastward toward The Narrows.
About December 3, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, another view.
About December 3, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

728542f-a.folder: Bay Street & Nautilus Street, Staten Island, NY
728542f-a.text:
Bay Street, at the N.E. corner of Nautilus Street. Shown is the old Doctor's Residence of the U. S. Quarantine
Station, said to be 10O years old.
Septewber 15, 1935
P. L. Sperr
(2)
A view at a later date, showing the houde under
demolition.
Septeaber 4, 1936.
P. L. Sperr
